intro: Aiouea maguireana, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous small seeds. Aiouea maguireana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
